definition: to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather

sentences.english: Huang feng man reaches the command, talk between an Jiang Yuan came in.
sentences.chinese: 黃鳴鋒等人到達司令部，說話間姜原進來寒暄。

sentences.english: Greetings involving kissing caused me to wince, and hugging generally just made me feel awkward.
sentences.chinese: 寒暄時的親吻讓我畏縮，而擁抱則會使我陷入尷尬。

sentences.english: My close friends and family needed no ceremonious preliminaries.
sentences.chinese: 我的密友和家人不需要跟我客套寒暄。

sentences.english: A man greets his family after a morning spent tending to his herds.
sentences.chinese: 在早上照看了他的牧羣后，這個男子跟家人寒暄。

sentences.english: Awareness alone an important figure in the head on the exchange, incomprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 光是認識重要人物，就寒暄得頭昏腦脹，不知所云。

sentences.english: Engage in small talk with company representatives, but avoid controversial topics.
sentences.chinese: 和公司代表寒暄，但是迴避有爭議的問題。

sentences.english: Exchange greetings after the two sides agree to meet again to examine the price.
sentences.chinese: 寒暄過後，雙方約好見面後再看房談價。

sentences.english: While/When (she was)leaving the house, she was heard to make some commonplace remark to her husband.
sentences.chinese: 有人聽到她在離開房間時同他的丈夫寒暄。

sentences.english: Pollard opened the conversation with some small talk.
sentences.chinese: 波拉德在寒暄中開始了談話。

sentences.english: He stopped right mest to me to greet his family.
sentences.chinese: 他在我身旁停下腳步，跟家人寒暄起來。

sentences.english: People who live in towns are often too busy to pass the time of day.
sentences.chinese: 在城裏生活的人往往忙碌得連寒暄都顧不上。

sentences.english: After an exchange of pleasantry the leader start their negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 領導人互相寒暄一番，然後開始談判。

definition: to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to reminisce/to talk about former times
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
